titles.title: A joint resolution disapproving a rule submitted by the Environmental Protection Agency relating to the mitigation by States of cross-border air pollution under the Clean Air Act.
A joint resolution disapproving a rule submitted by the Environmental Protection Agency relating to the mitigation by States of cross-border air pollution under the Clean Air Act.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.
Senate Committee on Environment and Public Works discharged by petition, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. 802(c).

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 220.

action.text: Motion to proceed to consideration of measure made in Senate.
Motion to proceed to consideration of measure rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 41 - 56. Record Vote Number: 201.

bill.summary: Disapproves the rule submitted by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) on July 11, 2011, entitled "Federal Implementation Plans: Interstate Transport of Fine Particulate Matter and Ozone and Correction of SIP Approvals," relating to the mitigation by states of cross-border air pollution under the Clean Air Act.
